About Me

BIO

I am currently obtaining a Bachelors of Science in Computer Information Systems. I am a highly motivated individual and I am enjoying the growth this opportunity has afforded me. Before going back to school, I used the skills I learned from the U.S. Army to work in the IT industry as a Support Technician. I decided to go back to school because I felt that I needed more out of a career. I work well with a team, but I am also able to thrive on my own. I pride myself in my work and my values. Every day I strive to better myself through learning something new.

City of Thomasville

IT Support Technician II

I installed and maintained a wide variety of systems desktop and server alike. I took support calls and created support tickets for over 500 users and 300 systems using BMC TrackIT. I maintained security groups within AD to ensure only the intended personnel could access network resources. I managed accounts and computers in AD based on company policy. I examined current systems and determined whether to upgrade them or to replace them for the most cost effective solution; and maintained future viability of the device.

United States Army - 54 Engineers Battalion

Information Technology Specialist

Maintained wide area networks, hardware, and software for a company of approximately one thousand personnel. Provided customer and network administration services allowing Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability for Approximately three hundred users.

United States Army - Remote Location

Information Technology Specialist

Worked at a satellite hub providing support over a WAN. Maintained routers, switches, servers, and satellite systems. Loaded and maintained security keys as required. Ran cable and rewired the entire facility to meet Army security standards. Helped replace core components to satellite receiving dishes. Provided customer support to all of Southwest East Asia.

United States Army - I-Corps

Information Technology Specialist

Specialized in the security of networks, hardware, and software for I-Corps. Some of the technology I was resposible for: network security, wireless security, update servers, backup servers, netowrk access control, firewalls, antivirus servers, and intrusion detection services.
